title: Open Science Workflow Training for ISC
text:
Why Open Science?


Standardized workflows and efficiency





Improve and support collaboration





Ensure our science is truly reproducible





Provide tools for sharing and communicating our work

title: Open Science Workflow Training for ISC
text:
Topics we will cover


Codespaces, and reproducible R environments




Transparent Assessment Framework (TAF)




Reproducible workflows using software containers




Creating reproducible reports and presentations




Creating websites to share results

title: Nicholas Ducharme-Barth
text:
Nicholas Ducharme-Barth joined the Pacific Islands Fisheries Science Center in 2021. Previously, Nicholas worked at the Pacific Community (SPC) conducting pelagic stock assessments for the Western and Central Pacific Fisheries Commission (WCPFC). He received his B.S. in Mathematics from the College of William & Mary and his Ph. D. in Fisheries and Aquatic Sciences from the University of Florida.
